本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Shishoku were short taimatsu, about eighteen inches long, designed for interior use.  Their tips were charred over a charcoal fire and rubbed with oil, and the grip section was paper-wrapped (p. 286). [松明]
